   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of traffic between two Diameter nodes, one client, one server.
   23: %% The traffic isn't meant to be sensible, just to exercise code.
   24: %%
   25: 
   26: -module(diameter_traffic_SUITE).
   27: 
   28: %% all tests, no common_test dependency
   29: -export([run/0,
   30:          run/1]).
   31: 
   32: %% common_test wrapping
   33: -export([suite/0,
   34:          all/0,
   35:          parallel/1]).
   36: 
   37: %% testcases
   38: -export([send_ok/1,
   39:          send_nok/1,
   40:          send_eval/1,
   41:          send_bad_answer/1,
   42:          send_protocol_error/1,
   43:          send_experimental_result/1,
   44:          send_arbitrary/1,
   45:          send_proxy_info/1,
   46:          send_unknown/1,
   47:          send_unknown_short/1,
   48:          send_unknown_mandatory/1,
   49:          send_unknown_short_mandatory/1,
   50:          send_noreply/1,
   51:          send_grouped_error/1,
   52:          send_unsupported/1,
   53:          send_unsupported_app/1,
   54:          send_error_bit/1,
   55:          send_unsupported_version/1,
   56:          send_long_avp_length/1,
   57:          send_short_avp_length/1,
   58:          send_zero_avp_length/1,
   59:          send_invalid_avp_length/1,
   60:          send_invalid_reject/1,
   61:          send_unexpected_mandatory_decode/1,
   62:          send_unexpected_mandatory/1,
   63:          send_too_many/1,
   64:          send_long/1,
   65:          send_maxlen/1,
   66:          send_nopeer/1,
   67:          send_noapp/1,
   68:          send_discard/1,
   69:          send_any_1/1,
   70:          send_any_2/1,
   71:          send_all_1/1,
   72:          send_all_2/1,
   73:          send_timeout/1,
   74:          send_error/1,
   75:          send_detach/1,
   76:          send_encode_error/1,
   77:          send_destination_1/1,
   78:          send_destination_2/1,
   79:          send_destination_3/1,
   80:          send_destination_4/1,
   81:          send_destination_5/1,
   82:          send_destination_6/1,
   83:          send_destination_7/1,
   84:          send_bad_option_1/1,
   85:          send_bad_option_2/1,
   86:          send_bad_filter_1/1,
   87:          send_bad_filter_2/1,
   88:          send_bad_filter_3/1,
   89:          send_bad_filter_4/1,
   90:          send_multiple_filters_1/1,
   91:          send_multiple_filters_2/1,
   92:          send_multiple_filters_3/1,
   93:          send_anything/1]).
   94: 
   95: %% diameter callbacks
   96: -export([peer_up/4,
   97:          peer_down/4,
   98:          pick_peer/7, pick_peer/8,
   99:          prepare_request/6, prepare_request/7,
  100:          prepare_retransmit/6,
  101:          handle_answer/7, handle_answer/8,
  102:          handle_error/7,
  103:          handle_request/4]).
  104: 
  105: %% diameter_{tcp,sctp} callbacks
  106: -export([message/3]).
  107: 
  108: -include_lib("kernel/include/inet_sctp.hrl").
  109: 
  110: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
  111: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_rfc3588.hrl").
  112: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_accounting.hrl").
  113: %% The listening transports use RFC 3588 dictionaries, the client
  114: %% transports use either 3588 or 6733. (So can't use the record
  115: %% definitions in the latter case.)
  116: 
  117: %% ===========================================================================
  118: 
  119: -define(util, diameter_util).
  120: 
  121: -define(A, list_to_atom).
  122: -define(L, atom_to_list).
  123: -define(B, iolist_to_binary).
  124: 
  125: %% Don't use is_record/2 since dictionary hrl's aren't included.
  126: %% (Since they define conflicting records with the same names.)
  127: -define(is_record(Rec, Name), (Name == element(1, Rec))).
  128: 
  129: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
  130: 
  131: -define(REALM, "erlang.org").
  132: -define(HOST(Host, Realm), Host ++ [$.|Realm]).
  133: 
  134: -define(EXTRA, an_extra_argument).
  135: 
  136: %% Sequence mask for End-to-End and Hop-by-Hop identifiers.
  137: -define(CLIENT_MASK, {1,26}).  %% 1 in top 6 bits
  138: 
  139: %% How to construct outgoing messages.
  140: -define(ENCODINGS, [list, record, map]).
  141: 
  142: %% How to decode incoming messages.
  143: -define(DECODINGS, [record, none, map, list, record_from_map]).
  144: 
  145: %% Which dictionary to use in the clients.
  146: -define(RFCS, [rfc3588, rfc6733, rfc4005]).
  147: 
  148: %% Which transport protocol to use.
  149: -define(TRANSPORTS, [sctp || ?util:have_sctp()] ++ [tcp]).
  150: 
  151: -record(group, {transport,
  152:                 strings,
  153:                 encoding,
  154:                 client_service,
  155:                 client_dict,
  156:                 client_sender,
  157:                 server_service,
  158:                 server_decoding,
  159:                 server_sender,
  160:                 server_throttle}).
  161: 
  162: %% Not really what we should be setting unless the message is sent in
  163: %% the common application but diameter doesn't care.
  164: -define(APP_ID, ?DIAMETER_APP_ID_COMMON).
  165: 
  166: %% An Application-ID the server doesn't support.
  167: -define(BAD_APP, 42).
  168: 
  169: %% A common match when receiving answers in a client.
  170: -define(answer_message(SessionId, ResultCode),
  171:         ['answer-message' | #{'Session-Id' := SessionId,
  172:                               'Origin-Host' := _,
  173:                               'Origin-Realm' := _,
  174:                               'Result-Code' := ResultCode}]).
  175: -define(answer_message(ResultCode),
  176:         ['answer-message' | #{'Origin-Host' := _,
  177:                               'Origin-Realm' := _,
  178:                               'Result-Code' := ResultCode}]).
  179: 
  180: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
  181: -define(SERVICE(Name, Grp),
  182:         [{'Origin-Host', Name ++ "." ++ ?REALM},
  183:          {'Origin-Realm', ?REALM},
  184:          {'Host-IP-Address', [?ADDR]},
  185:          {'Vendor-Id', 12345},
  186:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
  187:          {'Auth-Application-Id', [0]},  %% common messages
  188:          {'Acct-Application-Id', [3]},  %% base accounting
  189:          {restrict_connections, false},
  190:          {string_decode, Grp#group.strings},
  191:          {avp_dictionaries, [diameter_gen_doic_rfc7683]},
  192:          {incoming_maxlen, 1 bsl 21}
  193:          | [{application, [{dictionary, D},
  194:                            {module, [?MODULE, Grp]},
  195:                            {answer_errors, callback}]}
  196:             || D <- [diameter_gen_base_rfc3588,
  197:                      diameter_gen_base_accounting,
  198:                      diameter_gen_base_rfc6733,
  199:                      diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733,
  200:                      nas4005],
  201:                D /= nas4005 orelse have_nas()]]).
  202: 
  203: -define(SUCCESS,
  204:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_SUCCESS').
  205: -define(COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED,
  206:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED').
  207: -define(TOO_BUSY,
  208:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_TOO_BUSY').
  209: -define(APPLICATION_UNSUPPORTED,
  210:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_APPLICATION_UNSUPPORTED').
  211: -define(INVALID_HDR_BITS,
  212:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_INVALID_HDR_BITS').
  213: -define(INVALID_AVP_BITS,
  214:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_INVALID_AVP_BITS').
  215: -define(AVP_UNSUPPORTED,
  216:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_AVP_UNSUPPORTED').
  217: -define(UNSUPPORTED_VERSION,
  218:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_UNSUPPORTED_VERSION').
  219: -define(TOO_MANY,
  220:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_AVP_OCCURS_TOO_MANY_TIMES').
  221: -define(REALM_NOT_SERVED,
  222:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_REALM_NOT_SERVED').
  223: -define(UNABLE_TO_DELIVER,
  224:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_UNABLE_TO_DELIVER').
  225: -define(INVALID_AVP_LENGTH,
  226:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_INVALID_AVP_LENGTH').
  227: 
  228: -define(EVENT_RECORD,
  229:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_ACCOUNTING-RECORD-TYPE_EVENT_RECORD').
  230: -define(AUTHORIZE_ONLY,
  231:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RE-AUTH-REQUEST-TYPE_AUTHORIZE_ONLY').
  232: -define(AUTHORIZE_AUTHENTICATE,
  233:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RE-AUTH-REQUEST-TYPE_AUTHORIZE_AUTHENTICATE').
  234: 
  235: -define(LOGOUT,
  236:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_LOGOUT').
  237: -define(BAD_ANSWER,
  238:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_BAD_ANSWER').
  239: -define(USER_MOVED,
  240:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_USER_MOVED').
  241: 
  242: %% ===========================================================================
  243: %% common_test wrapping
  244: 
  245: suite() ->
  246:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 90}}].
  247: 
  248: all() ->
  249:     [parallel].
  250: 
  251: parallel(_Config) ->
  252:     run().
  253: 
  254: %% ===========================================================================
  255: 
  256: %% run/0
  257: %%
  258: %% The test cases proper, do or (meaningfully) die.
  259: %%
  260: %% Randomly choose one of many configuration possibilities. Testing
  261: %% all of them takes too much time, and randomly skipping various
  262: %% cases (as used to be the case) just unnecessary complexity. There
  263: %% are run night after night in on various hosts, so just choosing a
  264: %% configuration results in sufficient coverage over time.
  265: 
  266: run() ->
  267:     %% ok = logger:set_primary_config(level, debug),
  268:     Svc = ?util:unique_string(),
  269:     run(#group{transport = ?util:choose(?TRANSPORTS),
  270:                strings = bool(),
  271:                encoding = ?util:choose(?ENCODINGS),
  272:                client_service = [$C | Svc],
  273:                client_dict = appdict(?util:choose(?RFCS)),
  274:                client_sender = bool(),
  275:                server_service = [$S | Svc],
  276:                server_decoding = ?util:choose(?DECODINGS),
  277:                server_sender = true,  %% avoid deadlock
  278:                server_throttle = bool()}).
  279: 
  280: %% run/1
  281: 
  282: run(#group{} = Cfg) ->
  283:     _ = result_codes(Cfg),
  284:     io:format("config: ~p~n", [Cfg]),
  285:     try
  286:         ?util:run([{[fun traffic/1, Cfg], 60000}])
  287:     after
  288:         code:delete(nas4005),
  289:         code:purge(nas4005),
  290:         diameter:stop()
  291:     end.
  292: 
  293: %% traffic/1
  294: 
  295: traffic(#group{} = Cfg) ->
  296:     _ = compile_and_load(),
  297:     ok = diameter:start(),
  298:     LRef = server(Cfg),
  299:     ok = client(Cfg, LRef),
  300:     [] = send(Cfg),
  301:     print_services_info(),
  302:     ok = stop_services(Cfg),
  303:     [] = ets:tab2list(diameter_request).
  304: 
  305: 
  306: print_services_info() ->
  307:     print_services_info(diameter:services()).
  308: 
  309: print_services_info([]) ->
  310:     io:format("~n", []);
  311: print_services_info([Service | Services]) ->
  312:     io:format("~n   Service: ~s"
  313:               "~n      Config:"
  314:               "~n         ~p"
  315:               "~n      Which Connections:"
  316:               "~n         ~p"
  317:               "~n      Which Connections/Service:"
  318:               "~n         ~p"
  319:               "~n      Which Watchdogs:"
  320:               "~n         ~p"
  321:               "~n      Which Watchdogs/Service:"
  322:               "~n         ~p"
  323:               "~n      Which Transports:"
  324:               "~n         ~p"
  325:               "~n      Which Transports/Service:"
  326:               "~n         ~p"
  327:               "~n      Peers Info:"
  328:               "~n         ~p"
  329:               "~n      Transport Info:"
  330:               "~n         ~p"
  331:               "~n      All info:"
  332:               "~n         ~p",
  333:               [Service,
  334:                diameter_config:lookup(Service),
  335:                diameter:which_connections(),
  336:                diameter:which_connections(Service),
  337:                diameter:which_watchdogs(),
  338:                diameter:which_watchdogs(Service),
  339:                diameter:which_transports(),
  340:                diameter:which_transports(Service),
  341:                diameter:service_info(Service, peers),
  342:                diameter:service_info(Service, transport),
  343:                diameter:service_info(Service, all)]),
  344:     print_services_info(Services).
  345: 
  346: 
  347: %% start_service/2
  348: 
  349: start_service(Svc, Opts) ->
  350:     {ok, _} = {diameter:start_service(Svc, Opts), Opts},
  351:     ok.
  352: 
  353: %% send/1
  354: 
  355: send(Cfg) ->
  356:     Ref = make_ref(),
  357:     Refs = [R || {F,1} <- module_info(exports),
  358:                  "send_" ++ _ <- [atom_to_list(F)],
  359:                  I <- [fun() -> exit({Ref, send(F, Cfg)}) end],
  360:                  {_,R} <- [spawn_monitor(I)]],
  361:     lists:filter(fun({R,_}) -> R /= Ref; (_) -> true end, wait(Refs)).
  362: 
  363: %% send/2
  364: 
  365: send(F, #group{transport = sctp})
  366:   when F == send_long;
  367:        F == send_maxlen ->
  368:     ok;
  369: 
  370: send(F, Cfg) ->
  371:     timer:sleep(rand:uniform(2000)),
  372:     apply(?MODULE, F, [[{testcase, F}, {group, Cfg}]]).
  373: 
  374: %% wait/1
  375: 
  376: wait(Refs)
  377:   when is_list(Refs) ->
  378:     lists:map(fun wait/1, Refs);
  379: 
  380: wait(MRef) ->
  381:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, _, T} -> T end.
  382: 
  383: %% ===========================================================================
  384: 
  385: %% server/1
  386: 
  387: server(Config) ->
  388: 
  389:     logger:debug("entry with"
  390:                  "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  391: 
  392:     #group{transport = T,
  393:            client_sender = CS,
  394:            server_service = SN,
  395:            server_decoding = SD,
  396:            server_sender = SS,
  397:            server_throttle = ST}
  398:         = Grp
  399:         = group(Config),
  400:     ok = start_service(SN, [{traffic_counters, bool()},
  401:                             {decode_format, SD},
  402:                             {bins_info, bins_info()}
  403:                             | ?SERVICE(SN, Grp)]),
  404:     Cfg = [{sender, SS},
  405:            {message_cb, ST andalso {?MODULE, message, [0]}}]
  406:         ++ [{packet, ?util:choose([false, raw])} || T == sctp andalso CS]
  407:         ++ [{unordered, unordered()} || T == sctp],
  408:     Opts = [{capabilities_cb, fun capx/2},
  409:             {pool_size, 8}
  410:            | server_apps()],
  411:     _LRef = ?util:listen(SN, [T | Cfg], Opts).
  412: 
  413: %% client/1
  414: 
  415: client(Config, LRef) ->
  416: 
  417:     logger:debug("entry with"
  418:                  "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  419: 
  420:     #group{transport = T,
  421:            encoding = E,
  422:            client_service = CN,
  423:            client_sender = CS}
  424:         = Grp
  425:         = group(Config),
  426:     ok = start_service(CN, [{traffic_counters, bool()},
  427:                             {sequence, ?CLIENT_MASK},
  428:                             {decode_format, map},
  429:                             {strict_arities, decode},
  430:                             {bins_info, bins_info()}
  431:                             | ?SERVICE(CN, Grp)]),
  432:     _ = [?util:connect(CN, [T | C], LRef, O)
  433:          || C <- [[{sender, CS} | client_opts(T)]],
  434:             D <- ?DECODINGS,  %% for multiple candidate peers
  435:             R <- ?RFCS,
  436:             R /= rfc4005 orelse have_nas(),
  437:             I <- [{D,E}],
  438:             O <- [[{id, I}
  439:                   | client_apps(R, [{'Origin-State-Id', origin(I)}])]]],
  440:     ok.
  441: 
  442: bool() ->
  443:     0.5 =< rand:uniform().
  444: 
  445: bins_info() ->
  446:     %% Three possibilities: true | false | non_neg_integer()
  447:     %% We choose a low range, 42, only because our test does not
  448:     %% actually stress the system, so no point in picking a large
  449:     %% number.
  450:     ?util:choose([true, false, rand:uniform(42)]).
  451: 
  452: unordered() ->
  453:     ?util:choose([true, false, 1, 2]).
  454: 
  455: client_opts(tcp) ->
  456:     [];
  457: client_opts(sctp) ->
  458:     [{unordered, unordered()}
  459:      | [{sctp_initmsg, #sctp_initmsg{num_ostreams = N,
  460:                                      max_instreams = 5}}
  461:         || N <- [rand:uniform(8)],
  462:            N =< 6]].
  463: 
  464: server_apps() ->
  465:     B = have_nas(),
  466:     [{applications, [diameter_gen_base_rfc3588,
  467:                      diameter_gen_base_accounting]
  468:                     ++ [nas4005 || B]},
  469:      {capabilities, [{'Auth-Application-Id', [0] ++ [1 || B]}, %% common, NAS
  470:                      {'Acct-Application-Id', [3]}]}].          %% accounting
  471: 
  472: client_apps(rfc4005, Caps) ->
  473:     [{applications, [nas4005]},
  474:      {capabilities, [{'Auth-Application-Id', [1]},     %% NAS
  475:                      {'Acct-Application-Id', []}
  476:                     | Caps]}];
  477: client_apps(D, Caps) ->
  478:     D0 = dict0(D),
  479:     [{applications, [acct(D0), D0]},
  480:      {capabilities, Caps}].
  481: 
  482: have_nas() ->
  483:     false /= code:is_loaded(nas4005).
  484: 
  485: stop_services(Config) ->
  486:     #group{client_service = CN,
  487:            server_service = SN}
  488:         = group(Config),
  489:     ok = diameter:stop_service(CN),
  490:     ok = diameter:stop_service(SN).
  491: 
  492: capx(_, #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH,DH}}) ->
  493:     io:format("connection: ~p -> ~p~n", [DH,OH]),
  494:     ok.
  495: 
  496: %% ===========================================================================
  497: 
  498: %% Ensure that result codes have the expected values.
  499: result_codes(_Config) ->
  500:     {2001,
  501:      3001, 3002, 3003, 3004, 3007, 3008, 3009,
  502:      5001, 5009, 5011, 5014}
  503:         = {?SUCCESS,
  504:            ?COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED,
  505:            ?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER,
  506:            ?REALM_NOT_SERVED,
  507:            ?TOO_BUSY,
  508:            ?APPLICATION_UNSUPPORTED,
  509:            ?INVALID_HDR_BITS,
  510:            ?INVALID_AVP_BITS,
  511:            ?AVP_UNSUPPORTED,
  512:            ?TOO_MANY,
  513:            ?UNSUPPORTED_VERSION,
  514:            ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH}.
  515: 
  516: %% Send an ACR and expect success.
  517: send_ok(Config) ->
  518:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  519:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 1}],
  520:     ['ACA' | #{'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS,
  521:                'Session-Id' := _}]
  522:         = call(Config, Req).
  523: 
  524: %% Send an accounting ACR that the server answers badly to.
  525: send_nok(Config) ->
  526:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  527:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 0}],
  528: 
  529:     ?answer_message(?INVALID_AVP_BITS)
  530:         = call(Config, Req).
  531: 
  532: %% Send an ACR and expect success.
  533: send_eval(Config) ->
  534:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  535:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 3}],
  536: 
  537:     ['ACA' | #{'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS,
  538:                'Session-Id' := _}]
  539:         = call(Config, Req).
  540: 
  541: %% Send an accounting ACR that the server tries to answer with an
  542: %% inappropriate header. That the error is detected is coded in
  543: %% handle_answer.
  544: send_bad_answer(Config) ->
  545:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  546:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 2}],
  547:     ?answer_message(?SUCCESS)
  548:         = call(Config, Req).
  549: 
  550: %% Send an ACR that the server callback answers explicitly with a
  551: %% protocol error and some AVPs to check the decoding of.
  552: send_protocol_error(Config) ->
  553:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  554:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 4}],
  555: 
  556:     ['answer-message' | #{'Result-Code' := ?TOO_BUSY,
  557:                           'AVP' := [OLR | _]} = Avps]
  558:         = call(Config, Req),
  559: 
  560:     #diameter_avp{name = 'OC-OLR',
  561:                   value = #{'OC-Sequence-Number' := 1,
  562:                             'OC-Report-Type' := 0,  %% HOST_REPORT
  563:                             'OC-Reduction-Percentage' := [25],
  564:                             'OC-Validity-Duration' := [60],
  565:                             'AVP' := [OSF]}}
  566:         = OLR,
  567:     #diameter_avp{name = 'OC-Supported-Features',
  568:                   value = #{} = Fs}
  569:         = OSF,
  570:     0 = maps:size(Fs),
  571: 
  572:     #group{client_dict = D} = group(Config), 
  573: 
  574:     if D == nas4005 ->
  575:             error = maps:find('Failed-AVP', Avps),
  576:             #{'AVP' := [_,Failed]}
  577:                 = Avps,
  578:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Failed-AVP',
  579:                           value = #{'AVP' := [NP,FR,AP]}}
  580:                 = Failed,
  581:             #diameter_avp{name = 'NAS-Port',
  582:                           value = 44}
  583:                 = NP,
  584:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Firmware-Revision',
  585:                           value = 12}
  586:                 = FR,
  587:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Grace-Period',
  588:                           value = 13}
  589:                 = AP;
  590: 
  591:        D == diameter_gen_base_rfc3588;
  592:        D == diameter_gen_basr_accounting ->
  593:             error = maps:find('Failed-AVP', Avps),
  594:             #{'AVP' := [_,Failed]}
  595:                 = Avps,
  596: 
  597:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Failed-AVP',
  598:                            value = #{'AVP' := [NP,FR,AP]}}
  599:                 = Failed,
  600:             #diameter_avp{name = undefined,
  601:                           value = undefined}
  602:                 = NP,
  603:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Firmware-Revision',
  604:                           value = 12}
  605:                 = FR,
  606:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Grace-Period',
  607:                           value = 13}
  608:                 = AP;
  609: 
  610:        D == diameter_gen_base_rfc6733;
  611:        D == diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733 ->
  612:             #{'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [NP,FR,AP]}],
  613:               'AVP' := [_]}
  614:                 = Avps,
  615:             #diameter_avp{name = undefined,
  616:                           value = undefined}
  617:                 = NP,
  618:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Firmware-Revision',
  619:                           value = 12}
  620:                 = FR,
  621:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Grace-Period',
  622:                           value = 13}
  623:                 = AP
  624:     end.
  625: 
  626: %% Send a 3xxx Experimental-Result in an answer not setting the E-bit
  627: %% and missing a Result-Code.
  628: send_experimental_result(Config) ->
  629:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  630:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 5}],
  631:     ['ACA' | #{'Session-Id' := _}]
  632:         = call(Config, Req).
  633: 
  634: %% Send an ASR with an arbitrary non-mandatory AVP and expect success
  635: %% and the same AVP in the reply.
  636: send_arbitrary(Config) ->
  637:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{name = 'Product-Name',
  638:                                          value = "XXX"}]}],
  639:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  640:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS,
  641:                'AVP' := [#diameter_avp{name = 'Product-Name',
  642:                                        value = V}]}]
  643:         = call(Config, Req),
  644:     "XXX" = string(V, Config).
  645: 
  646: %% Send Proxy-Info in an ASR that the peer answers with 3xxx, and
  647: %% ensure that the AVP is returned.
  648: send_proxy_info(Config) ->
  649:     H0 = ?B(?util:unique_string()),
  650:     S0 = ?B(?util:unique_string()),
  651:     Req = ['ASR', {'Proxy-Info', #{'Proxy-Host'  => H0,
  652:                                    'Proxy-State' => S0}}],
  653:     ['answer-message' | #{'Result-Code' := 3999,
  654:                           'Proxy-Info' := [#{'Proxy-Host' := H,
  655:                                              'Proxy-State' := S}]}]
  656:         = call(Config, Req),
  657:     [H0, S0] = [?B(X) || X <- [H,S]].
  658: 
  659: %% Send an unknown AVP (to some client) and check that it comes back.
  660: send_unknown(Config) ->
  661:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{code = 999,
  662:                                          is_mandatory = false,
  663:                                          data = <<17>>}]}],
  664:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  665:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS,
  666:                'AVP' := [#diameter_avp{code = 999,
  667:                                        is_mandatory = false,
  668:                                        data = <<17>>}]}]
  669:         = call(Config, Req).
  670: 
  671: %% Ditto, and point the AVP length past the end of the message. Expect
  672: %% 5014.
  673: send_unknown_short(Config) ->
  674:     send_unknown_short(Config, false, ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH).
  675: 
  676: send_unknown_short(Config, M, RC) ->
  677:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{code = 999,
  678:                                          is_mandatory = M,
  679:                                          data = <<17>>}]}],
  680:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  681:                'Result-Code' := RC,
  682:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  683:         = call(Config, Req),
  684:     #diameter_avp{code = 999,
  685:                   is_mandatory = M,
  686:                   data = <<17, _/binary>>} %% extra bits from padding
  687:         = Avp.
  688: 
  689: %% Ditto but set the M flag.
  690: send_unknown_mandatory(Config) ->
  691:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{code = 999,
  692:                                          is_mandatory = true,
  693:                                          data = <<17>>}]}],
  694:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  695:                'Result-Code' := ?AVP_UNSUPPORTED,
  696:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  697:         = call(Config, Req),
  698:     #diameter_avp{code = 999,
  699:                   is_mandatory = true,
  700:                   data = <<17>>}
  701:         = Avp.
  702: 
  703: %% Ditto, and point the AVP length past the end of the message. Expect
  704: %% 5014 instead of 5001.
  705: send_unknown_short_mandatory(Config) ->
  706:     send_unknown_short(Config, true, ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH).
  707: 
  708: %% Send an ASR containing an unexpected mandatory Session-Timeout.
  709: %% Expect 5001, and check that the value in Failed-AVP was decoded.
  710: send_unexpected_mandatory_decode(Config) ->
  711:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{code = 27,  %% Session-Timeout
  712:                                          is_mandatory = true,
  713:                                          data = <<12:32>>}]}],
  714:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  715:                'Result-Code' := ?AVP_UNSUPPORTED,
  716:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  717:         = call(Config, Req),
  718:     #diameter_avp{code = 27,
  719:                   is_mandatory = true,
  720:                   value = 12,
  721:                   data = <<12:32>>}
  722:         = Avp.
  723: 
  724: %% Try to two Auth-Application-Id in ASR expect 5009.
  725: send_too_many(Config) ->
  726:     Req = ['ASR', {'Auth-Application-Id', [?APP_ID, 44]}],
  727: 
  728:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  729:                'Result-Code' := ?TOO_MANY,
  730:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  731:         = call(Config, Req),
  732:     #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Application-Id',
  733:                   value = 44}
  734:         = Avp.
  735: 
  736: %% Send an containing a faulty Grouped AVP (empty Proxy-Host in
  737: %% Proxy-Info) and expect that only the faulty AVP is sent in
  738: %% Failed-AVP. The encoded values of Proxy-Host and Proxy-State are
  739: %% swapped in prepare_request since an empty Proxy-Host is an encode
  740: %% error.
  741: send_grouped_error(Config) ->
  742:     Req = ['ASR', {'Proxy-Info', [[{'Proxy-Host', "abcd"},
  743:                                    {'Proxy-State', ""}]]}],
  744:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  745:                'Result-Code' := ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH,
  746:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  747:         = call(Config, Req),
  748:     #diameter_avp{name = 'Proxy-Info', value = #{'Proxy-Host' := H}}
  749:         = Avp,
  750:     <<0>> = ?B(H).
  751: 
  752: %% Send an STR that the server ignores.
  753: send_noreply(Config) ->
  754:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?BAD_ANSWER}],
  755:     {timeout, _} = call(Config, Req).
  756: 
  757: %% Send an unsupported command and expect 3001.
  758: send_unsupported(Config) ->
  759:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?BAD_ANSWER}],
  760:     ?answer_message(?COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED)
  761:         = call(Config, Req).
  762: 
  763: %% Send an unsupported application and expect 3007.
  764: send_unsupported_app(Config) ->
  765:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?BAD_ANSWER}],
  766:     ?answer_message(?APPLICATION_UNSUPPORTED)
  767:         = call(Config, Req).
  768: 
  769: %% Send a request with the E bit set and expect 3008.
  770: send_error_bit(Config) ->
  771:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?BAD_ANSWER}],
  772:     ?answer_message(?INVALID_HDR_BITS)
  773:         = call(Config, Req).
  774: 
  775: %% Send a bad version and check that we get 5011.
  776: send_unsupported_version(Config) ->
  777:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  778:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  779:                'Result-Code' := ?UNSUPPORTED_VERSION}]
  780:         = call(Config, Req).
  781: 
  782: %% Send a request containing an AVP length > data size.
  783: send_long_avp_length(Config) ->
  784:     send_invalid_avp_length(Config).
  785: 
  786: %% Send a request containing an AVP length < data size.
  787: send_short_avp_length(Config) ->
  788:     send_invalid_avp_length(Config).
  789: 
  790: %% Send a request containing an AVP whose advertised length is < 8.
  791: send_zero_avp_length(Config) ->
  792:     send_invalid_avp_length(Config).
  793: 
  794: %% Send a request containing an AVP length that doesn't match the
  795: %% AVP's type.
  796: send_invalid_avp_length(Config) ->
  797:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  798: 
  799:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  800:                'Result-Code' := ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH,
  801:                'Origin-Host' := _,
  802:                'Origin-Realm' := _,
  803:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [_]}]}]
  804:         = call(Config, Req).
  805: 
  806: %% Send a request containing 5xxx errors that the server rejects with
  807: %% 3xxx.
  808: send_invalid_reject(Config) ->
  809:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?USER_MOVED}],
  810: 
  811:     ?answer_message(?TOO_BUSY)
  812:         = call(Config, Req).
  813: 
  814: %% Send an STR containing a known AVP, but one that's not expected and
  815: %% that sets the M-bit.
  816: send_unexpected_mandatory(Config) ->
  817:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  818: 
  819:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  820:                'Result-Code' := ?AVP_UNSUPPORTED}]
  821:         = call(Config, Req).
  822: 
  823: %% Send something long that will be fragmented by TCP.
  824: send_long(Config) ->
  825:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  826:                   {'User-Name', [binary:copy(<<$X>>, 1 bsl 20)]}],
  827:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  828:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  829:         = call(Config, Req).
  830: 
  831: %% Send something longer than the configure incoming_maxlen.
  832: send_maxlen(Config) ->
  833:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  834:                   {'User-Name', [binary:copy(<<$X>>, 1 bsl 21)]}],
  835:     {timeout, _} = call(Config, Req).
  836: 
  837: %% Send something for which pick_peer finds no suitable peer.
  838: send_nopeer(Config) ->
  839:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  840:     {error, no_connection} = call(Config, Req, [{extra, [?EXTRA]}]).
  841: 
  842: %% Send something on an unconfigured application.
  843: send_noapp(Config) ->
  844:     #group{client_service = CN}
  845:         = group(Config),
  846:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  847:     {error, no_connection} = diameter:call(CN, unknown_alias, Req).
  848: 
  849: %% Send something that's discarded by prepare_request.
  850: send_discard(Config) ->
  851:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  852:     {error, unprepared} = call(Config, Req).
  853: 
  854: %% Send with a disjunctive filter.
  855: send_any_1(Config) ->
  856:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  857:     {error, no_connection} = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {any, []}}]).
  858: send_any_2(Config) ->
  859:     #group{server_service = SN}
  860:         = group(Config),
  861:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  862:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, "unknown.org")]}],
  863:     ?answer_message(?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER)
  864:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {first, [{all, [host, realm]},
  865:                                                realm]}}]).
  866: 
  867: %% Send with a conjunctive filter.
  868: send_all_1(Config) ->
  869:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  870:     Realm = lists:foldr(fun(C,A) -> [C,A] end, [], ?REALM),
  871:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  872:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  873:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [{host, any},
  874:                                              {realm, Realm}]}}]).
  875: send_all_2(Config) ->
  876:     #group{server_service = SN}
  877:         = group(Config),
  878:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  879:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, "unknown.org")]}],
  880:     {error, no_connection}
  881:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  882: 
  883: %% Timeout before the server manages an answer.
  884: send_timeout(Config) ->
  885:     Req = ['RAR', {'Re-Auth-Request-Type', ?AUTHORIZE_ONLY}],
  886:     {timeout, _} = call(Config, Req, [{timeout, 1000}]).
  887: 
  888: %% Explicitly answer with an answer-message and ensure that we
  889: %% received the Session-Id.
  890: send_error(Config) ->
  891:     Req = ['RAR', {'Re-Auth-Request-Type', ?AUTHORIZE_AUTHENTICATE}],
  892:     ?answer_message([_], ?TOO_BUSY)
  893:         = call(Config, Req).
  894: 
  895: %% Send a request with the detached option and receive it as a message
  896: %% from handle_answer instead.
  897: send_detach(Config) ->
  898:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  899:     Ref = make_ref(),
  900:     ok = call(Config, Req, [{extra, [{self(), Ref}]}, detach]),
  901:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  902:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  903:         = receive {Ref, T} -> T end.
  904: 
  905: %% Send a request which can't be encoded and expect {error, encode}.
  906: send_encode_error(Config) ->
  907:     {error, encode} = call(Config, ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', huh}]).
  908: 
  909: %% Send with filtering and expect success.
  910: send_destination_1(Config) ->
  911:     #group{server_service = SN}
  912:         = group(Config),
  913:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  914:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, ?REALM)]}],
  915:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  916:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  917:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  918: send_destination_2(Config) ->
  919:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  920:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  921:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  922:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  923: 
  924: %% Send with filtering on and expect failure when specifying an
  925: %% unknown host or realm.
  926: send_destination_3(Config) ->
  927:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  928:                   {'Destination-Realm', <<"unknown.org">>}],
  929:     {error, no_connection}
  930:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  931: send_destination_4(Config) ->
  932:     #group{server_service = SN}
  933:         = group(Config),
  934:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  935:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, ["unknown.org"])]}],
  936:     {error, no_connection}
  937:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  938: 
  939: %% Send without filtering and expect an error answer when specifying
  940: %% an unknown host or realm.
  941: send_destination_5(Config) ->
  942:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  943:                   {'Destination-Realm', [<<"unknown.org">>]}],
  944:     ?answer_message(?REALM_NOT_SERVED)
  945:         = call(Config, Req).
  946: send_destination_6(Config) ->
  947:     #group{server_service = SN}
  948:         = group(Config),
  949:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  950:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, "unknown.org")]}],
  951:     ?answer_message(?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER)
  952:         = call(Config, Req).
  953: 
  954: %% Send unknown host in diameter_packet with filtering and expect error.
  955: send_destination_7(Config) ->
  956:     #group{client_service = CN,
  957:            client_dict = Dict0}
  958:         = group(Config),
  959:     Name = proplists:get_value(testcase, Config),
  960:     Svc = ?util:unique_string(),
  961:     SN = [$S | Svc],
  962:     Req =
  963:         #diameter_packet{msg = ['STR' |
  964:                                 #{'Termination-Cause' => ?LOGOUT,
  965:                                   'Destination-Host' => [?HOST(SN, ?REALM)]}]},
  966:     {error, no_connection} =
  967:         diameter:call(CN,
  968:                       Dict0,
  969:                       Req,
  970:                       [{extra, [Name, diameter_lib:now()]},
  971:                        {filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  972: 
  973: %% Specify an invalid option and expect failure.
  974: send_bad_option_1(Config) ->
  975:     send_bad_option(Config, x).
  976: send_bad_option_2(Config) ->
  977:     send_bad_option(Config, {extra, false}).
  978: 
  979: send_bad_option(Config, Opt) ->
  980:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  981:     try call(Config, Req, [Opt]) of
  982:         T -> erlang:error({?MODULE, ?LINE, T})
  983:     catch
  984:         error: _ -> ok
  985:     end.
  986: 
  987: %% Specify an invalid filter and expect no matching peers.
  988: send_bad_filter_1(Config) ->
  989:     send_bad_filter(Config, {all, none}).
  990: send_bad_filter_2(Config) ->
  991:     send_bad_filter(Config, {host, x}).
  992: send_bad_filter_3(Config) ->
  993:     send_bad_filter(Config, {eval, fun() -> true end}).
  994: send_bad_filter_4(Config) ->
  995:     send_bad_filter(Config, {eval, {?MODULE, not_exported, []}}).
  996: 
  997: send_bad_filter(Config, F) ->
  998:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  999:     {error, no_connection} = call(Config, Req, [{filter, F}]).
 1000: 
 1001: %% Specify multiple filter options and expect them be conjunctive.
 1002: send_multiple_filters_1(Config) ->
 1003:     Fun = fun(#diameter_caps{}) -> true end,
 1004:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
 1005:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
 1006:         = send_multiple_filters(Config, [host, {eval, Fun}]).
 1007: send_multiple_filters_2(Config) ->
 1008:     E = {erlang, is_tuple, []},
 1009:     {error, no_connection}
 1010:         = send_multiple_filters(Config, [realm, {neg, {eval, E}}]).
 1011: send_multiple_filters_3(Config) ->
 1012:     E1 = [fun(#diameter_caps{}, ok) -> true end, ok],
 1013:     E2 = {erlang, is_tuple, []},
 1014:     E3 = {erlang, is_record, [diameter_caps]},
 1015:     E4 = [{erlang, is_record, []}, diameter_caps],
 1016:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
 1017:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
 1018:         = send_multiple_filters(Config, [{eval, E} || E <- [E1,E2,E3,E4]]).
 1019: 
 1020: send_multiple_filters(Config, Fs) ->
 1021:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
 1022:     call(Config, Req, [{filter, F} || F <- Fs]).
 1023: 
 1024: %% Ensure that we can pass a request in any form to diameter:call/4,
 1025: %% only the return value from the prepare_request callback being
 1026: %% significant.
 1027: send_anything(Config) ->
 1028:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
 1029:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
 1030:         = call(Config, anything).
 1031: 
 1032: %% ===========================================================================
 1033: 
 1034: group(#group{} = Rec) ->
 1035:     Rec;
 1036: group(Config) ->
 1037:     #group{} = proplists:get_value(group, Config).
 1038: 
 1039: string(V, Config) ->
 1040:     #group{strings = B} = group(Config),
 1041:     decode(V,B).
 1042: 
 1043: decode(S, true)
 1044:   when is_list(S) ->
 1045:     S;
 1046: decode(B, false)
 1047:   when is_binary(B) ->
 1048:     binary_to_list(B).
 1049: 
 1050: call(Config, Req) ->
 1051:     call(Config, Req, []).
 1052: 
 1053: call(Config, Req, Opts) ->
 1054:     Name = proplists:get_value(testcase, Config),
 1055:     #group{encoding = Enc,
 1056:            client_service = CN,
 1057:            client_dict = Dict0}
 1058:         = group(Config),
 1059:     diameter:call(CN,
 1060:                   dict(Req, Dict0),
 1061:                   msg(Req, Enc, Dict0),
 1062:                   [{extra, [Name, diameter_lib:now()]} | Opts]).
 1063: 
 1064: origin({D,E}) ->
 1065:     4*decode(D) + encode(E);
 1066: 
 1067: origin(N) ->
 1068:     {decode(N bsr 2), encode(N rem 4)}.
 1069: 
 1070: %% Map atoms. The atoms are part of (constructed) group names, so it's
 1071: %% good that they're readable.
 1072: 
 1073: decode(record) -> 0;
 1074: decode(list)   -> 1;
 1075: decode(map)    -> 2;
 1076: decode(none)   -> 3;
 1077: decode(record_from_map) -> 4;
 1078: decode(0) -> record;
 1079: decode(1) -> list;
 1080: decode(2) -> map;
 1081: decode(3) -> none;
 1082: decode(4) -> record_from_map.
 1083: 
 1084: encode(record) -> 0;
 1085: encode(list)   -> 1;
 1086: encode(map)    -> 2;
 1087: encode(0) -> record;
 1088: encode(1) -> list;
 1089: encode(2) -> map.
 1090: 
 1091: msg([H|_] = Msg, record = E, diameter_gen_base_rfc3588)
 1092:   when H == 'ACR';
 1093:        H == 'ACA' ->
 1094:     msg(Msg, E, diameter_gen_base_accounting);
 1095: 
 1096: msg([H|_] = Msg, record = E, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733)
 1097:   when H == 'ACR';
 1098:        H == 'ACA' ->
 1099:     msg(Msg, E, diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733);
 1100: 
 1101: msg([H|T], record, Dict) ->
 1102:     Dict:'#new-'(Dict:msg2rec(H), T);
 1103: 
 1104: msg([H|As], map, _)
 1105:   when is_list(As) ->
 1106:     [H | maps:from_list(As)];
 1107: 
 1108: msg(Msg, _, _) ->
 1109:     Msg.
 1110: 
 1111: to_map(#diameter_packet{msg = [_MsgName | Avps] = Msg},
 1112:        #group{server_decoding = map})
 1113:   when is_map(Avps) ->
 1114:     Msg;
 1115: 
 1116: to_map(#diameter_packet{msg = [MsgName | Avps]},
 1117:        #group{server_decoding = list}) ->
 1118:     [MsgName | maps:from_list(Avps)];
 1119: 
 1120: to_map(#diameter_packet{header = H, msg = Rec},
 1121:        #group{server_decoding = D})
 1122:   when D == record;
 1123:        D == record_from_map ->
 1124:     rec_to_map(Rec, dict(H));
 1125: 
 1126: %% No record decode: do it ourselves.
 1127: to_map(#diameter_packet{header = H,
 1128:                         msg = Name,
 1129:                         bin = Bin},
 1130:       #group{server_decoding = none,
 1131:              strings = B}) ->
 1132:     Opts = #{decode_format => map,
 1133:              string_decode => B,
 1134:              avp_dictionaries => [diameter_gen_doic_rfc7683],
 1135:              strict_mbit => true,
 1136:              rfc => 6733},
 1137:     #diameter_packet{msg = [MsgName | _Map] = Msg}
 1138:         = diameter_codec:decode(dict(H), Opts, Bin),
 1139:     {MsgName, _} = {Name, Msg},  %% assert
 1140:     Msg.
 1141: 
 1142: dict(#diameter_header{application_id = Id,
 1143:                       cmd_code = Code}) ->
 1144:     if Id == 1 ->
 1145:             nas4005;
 1146:        Code == 271 ->
 1147:             diameter_gen_base_accounting;
 1148:        true ->
 1149:             diameter_gen_base_rfc3588
 1150:     end.
 1151: 
 1152: rec_to_map(Rec, Dict) ->
 1153:     [R | Vs] = Dict:'#get-'(Rec),
 1154:     [Dict:rec2msg(R) | maps:from_list([T || {_,V} = T <- Vs,
 1155:                                             V /= undefined,
 1156:                                             V /= []])].
 1157: 
 1158: appdict(rfc4005) ->
 1159:     nas4005;
 1160: appdict(D) ->
 1161:     dict0(D).
 1162: 
 1163: dict0(D) ->
 1164:     ?A("diameter_gen_base_" ++ ?L(D)).
 1165: 
 1166: dict(Msg, Dict) ->
 1167:     d(name(Msg), Dict).
 1168: 
 1169: d(N, nas4005 = D) ->
 1170:     if N == {list, 'answer-message'};
 1171:        N == {map, 'answer-message'};
 1172:        N == {record, 'diameter_base_answer-message'} ->
 1173:             diameter_gen_base_rfc3588;
 1174:        true ->
 1175:             D
 1176:     end;
 1177: d(N, Dict0)
 1178:   when N == {list, 'ACR'};
 1179:        N == {list, 'ACA'};
 1180:        N == {map, 'ACR'};
 1181:        N == {map, 'ACA'};
 1182:        N == {record, diameter_base_accounting_ACR};
 1183:        N == {record, diameter_base_accounting_ACA} ->
 1184:     acct(Dict0);
 1185: d(_, Dict0) ->
 1186:     Dict0.
 1187: 
 1188: acct(diameter_gen_base_rfc3588) ->
 1189:     diameter_gen_base_accounting;
 1190: acct(diameter_gen_base_rfc6733) ->
 1191:     diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733.
 1192: 
 1193: %% Set only values that aren't already.
 1194: 
 1195: set(_, [N | As], Vs) ->
 1196:     [N | if is_map(As) ->
 1197:                  maps:merge(maps:from_list(Vs), As);
 1198:             is_list(As) ->
 1199:                  Vs ++ As
 1200:          end];
 1201: 
 1202: set(#group{client_dict = Dict0} = _Group, Rec, Vs) ->
 1203:     Dict = dict(Rec, Dict0),
 1204:     lists:foldl(fun({F,_} = FV, A) ->
 1205:                         reset(Dict, Dict:'#get-'(F, A), FV, A)
 1206:                 end,
 1207:                 Rec,
 1208:                 Vs).
 1209: 
 1210: reset(Dict, E, FV, Rec)
 1211:   when E == undefined;
 1212:        E == [] ->
 1213:     Dict:'#set-'(FV, Rec);
 1214: 
 1215: reset(_, _, _, Rec) ->
 1216:     Rec.
 1217: 
 1218: %% ===========================================================================
 1219: %% diameter callbacks
 1220: 
 1221: %% peer_up/4
 1222: 
 1223: peer_up(_SvcName, _Peer, State, _Group) ->
 1224:     State.
 1225: 
 1226: %% peer_down/3
 1227: 
 1228: peer_down(_SvcName, _Peer, State, _Group) ->
 1229:     State.
 1230: 
 1231: %% pick_peer/7-8
 1232: 
 1233: pick_peer(Peers, _, [$C|_], _State, Group, Name, _)
 1234:   when Name /= send_detach ->
 1235:     find(Group, Peers).
 1236: 
 1237: pick_peer(_Peers, _, [$C|_], _State, _Group, send_nopeer, _, ?EXTRA) ->
 1238:     false;
 1239: 
 1240: pick_peer(Peers, _, [$C|_], _State, Group, send_detach, _, {_,_}) ->
 1241:     find(Group, Peers).
 1242: 
 1243: find(#group{encoding = E,
 1244:             client_service = CN,
 1245:             server_decoding = D},
 1246:      [_|_] = Peers) ->
 1247:     Id = {D,E},
 1248:     [P] = [P || P <- Peers, id(Id, P, CN)],
 1249:     {ok, P}.
 1250: 
 1251: id(Id, {Pid, _Caps}, SvcName) ->
 1252:     [{ref, _}, {type, _}, {options, Opts} | _]
 1253:         = diameter:service_info(SvcName, Pid),
 1254:     lists:member({id, Id}, Opts).
 1255: 
 1256: %% prepare_request/6-7
 1257: prepare_request(_Pkt, [$C|_], {_Ref, _Caps}, _, send_discard, _) ->
 1258:     {discard, unprepared};
 1259: 
 1260: prepare_request(Pkt, [$C|_], {_Ref, Caps}, Group, Name, _) ->
 1261:     {send, prepare(Pkt, Caps, Name, Group)}.
 1262: 
 1263: prepare_request(Pkt, [$C|_], {_Ref, Caps}, Group, send_detach, _, _) ->
 1264:     {eval_packet, {send, prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group)}, [fun log/2, detach]}.
 1265: 
 1266: log(#diameter_packet{bin = Bin} = P, T)
 1267:   when is_binary(Bin) ->
 1268:     io:format("~p: ~p~n", [T,P]).
 1269: 
 1270: %% prepare/4
 1271: 
 1272: prepare(Pkt, Caps, N, #group{client_dict = Dict0} = Group)
 1273:   when N == send_unknown_short_mandatory;
 1274:        N == send_unknown_short ->
 1275:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1276: 
 1277:     #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{length = L},
 1278:                      bin = Bin}
 1279:         = E
 1280:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1281: 
 1282:     %% Find the unknown AVP data at the end of the message and alter
 1283:     %% its length header.
 1284: 
 1285:     {Padding, [17|_]} = lists:splitwith(fun(C) -> C == 0 end,
 1286:                                        lists:reverse(binary_to_list(Bin))),
 1287: 
 1288:     Offset = L - length(Padding) - 4,
 1289:     <<H:Offset/binary, Len:24, T/binary>> = Bin,
 1290:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary, (Len+9):24, T/binary>>};
 1291: 
 1292: prepare(Pkt, Caps, N, #group{client_dict = Dict0} = Group)
 1293:   when N == send_long_avp_length;
 1294:        N == send_short_avp_length;
 1295:        N == send_zero_avp_length ->
 1296:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1297:     %% Second last AVP in our STR is Auth-Application-Id of type
 1298:     %% Unsigned32: set AVP Length to a value other than 12 and place
 1299:     %% it last in the message (so as not to mess with Termination-Cause).
 1300:     #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{length = L},
 1301:                      bin = B}
 1302:         = E
 1303:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1304:     Offset = L - 24,  %% to Auth-Application-Id
 1305:     <<H:Offset/binary,
 1306:       Hdr:5/binary, 12:24, Data:4/binary,
 1307:       T:12/binary>>
 1308:         = B,
 1309:     AL = case N of
 1310:              send_long_avp_length  -> 13;
 1311:              send_short_avp_length -> 11;
 1312:              send_zero_avp_length  -> 0
 1313:          end,
 1314:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary,
 1315:                               T/binary,
 1316:                               Hdr/binary, AL:24, Data/binary>>};
 1317: 
 1318: prepare(Pkt, Caps, N, #group{client_dict = Dict0} = Group)
 1319:   when N == send_invalid_avp_length;
 1320:        N == send_invalid_reject ->
 1321:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1322:     %% Second last AVP in our STR is Auth-Application-Id of type
 1323:     %% Unsigned32: send data of length 8.
 1324:     #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{length = L},
 1325:                      bin = B0}
 1326:         = E
 1327:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1328:     Offset = L - 7 - 12,  %% to AVP Length
 1329:     <<H0:Offset/binary, 12:24, T:16/binary>> = B0,
 1330:     <<V, L:24, H/binary>> = H0,  %% assert
 1331:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<V, (L+4):24, H/binary, 16:24, 0:32, T/binary>>};
 1332: 
 1333: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_unexpected_mandatory, #group{client_dict = Dict0}
 1334:                                               = Group) ->
 1335:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1336:     #diameter_packet{bin = <<V, Len:24, T/binary>>}
 1337:         = E
 1338:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1339:     {Code, Flags, undefined} = Dict0:avp_header('Proxy-State'),
 1340:     Avp = <<Code:32, Flags, 8:24>>,
 1341:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<V, (Len+8):24, T/binary, Avp/binary>>};
 1342: 
 1343: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_grouped_error, #group{client_dict = Dict0}
 1344:                                               = Group) ->
 1345:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1346:     #diameter_packet{bin = Bin}
 1347:         = E
 1348:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1349:     {Code, Flags, undefined} = Dict0:avp_header('Proxy-Info'),
 1350:     %% Find Proxy-Info by looking for its header.
 1351:     Pattern = <<Code:32, Flags, 28:24>>,
 1352:     {Offset, 8} = binary:match(Bin, Pattern),
 1353: 
 1354:     %% Extract and swap Proxy-Host/State payloads.
 1355: 
 1356:     <<H:Offset/binary,
 1357:       PI:8/binary,
 1358:       PH:5/binary,
 1359:       12:24,
 1360:       Payload:4/binary,
 1361:       PS:5/binary,
 1362:       8:24,
 1363:       T/binary>>
 1364:         = Bin,
 1365: 
 1366:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary,
 1367:                               PI/binary,
 1368:                               PH/binary,
 1369:                               8:24,
 1370:                               PS:5/binary,
 1371:                               12:24,
 1372:                               Payload/binary,
 1373:                               T/binary>>};
 1374: 
 1375: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_unsupported, #group{client_dict = Dict0} = Group) ->
 1376:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1377:     #diameter_packet{bin = <<H:5/binary, _CmdCode:3/binary, T/binary>>}
 1378:         = E
 1379:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1380:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary, 42:24, T/binary>>};
 1381: 
 1382: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_unsupported_app, #group{client_dict = Dict0}
 1383:                                          = Group) ->
 1384:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1385:     #diameter_packet{bin = <<H:8/binary, _ApplId:4/binary, T/binary>>}
 1386:         = E
 1387:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1388:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary, ?BAD_APP:32, T/binary>>};
 1389: 
 1390: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_error_bit, Group) ->
 1391:     #diameter_packet{header = Hdr} = Pkt,
 1392:     Pkt#diameter_packet{header = Hdr#diameter_header{is_error = true},
 1393:                         msg = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group)};
 1394: 
 1395: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_unsupported_version, Group) ->
 1396:     #diameter_packet{header = Hdr} = Pkt,
 1397:     Pkt#diameter_packet{header = Hdr#diameter_header{version = 42},
 1398:                         msg = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group)};
 1399: 
 1400: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_anything, Group) ->
 1401:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
 1402:     prepare(Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group);
 1403: 
 1404: prepare(Pkt, Caps, _Name, Group) ->
 1405:     prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group).
 1406: 
 1407: %% prepare/3
 1408: 
 1409: prepare(#diameter_packet{msg = Req} = Pkt, Caps, Group) ->
 1410:     set(name(Req), Pkt, Caps, Group).
 1411: 
 1412: %% set/4
 1413: 
 1414: set(N, #diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group)
 1415:   when N == {record, diameter_base_accounting_ACR};
 1416:        N == {record, nas_ACR};
 1417:        N == {map, 'ACR'};
 1418:        N == {list, 'ACR'} ->
 1419:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
 1420:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
 1421:         = Caps,
 1422: 
 1423:     set(Group, Req, [{'Session-Id', [diameter:session_id(OH)]},
 1424:                      {'Origin-Host',  [OH]},
 1425:                      {'Origin-Realm', [OR]},
 1426:                      {'Destination-Realm', [DR]}]);
 1427: 
 1428: set(N, #diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group)
 1429:   when N == {record, diameter_base_ASR};
 1430:        N == {record, nas_ASR};
 1431:        N == {map, 'ASR'};
 1432:        N == {list, 'ASR'} ->
 1433:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, DH},
 1434:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
 1435:         = Caps,
 1436:     set(Group, Req, [{'Session-Id', [diameter:session_id(OH)]},
 1437:                      {'Origin-Host',  [OH]},
 1438:                      {'Origin-Realm', [OR]},
 1439:                      {'Destination-Host',  [DH]},
 1440:                      {'Destination-Realm', [DR]},
 1441:                      {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID}]);
 1442: 
 1443: set(N, #diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group)
 1444:   when N == {record, diameter_base_STR};
 1445:        N == {record, nas_STR};
 1446:        N == {map, 'STR'};
 1447:        N == {list, 'STR'} ->
 1448:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
 1449:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
 1450:         = Caps,
 1451:     set(Group, Req, [{'Session-Id', [diameter:session_id(OH)]},
 1452:                      {'Origin-Host',  [OH]},
 1453:                      {'Origin-Realm', [OR]},
 1454:                      {'Destination-Realm', [DR]},
 1455:                      {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID}]);
 1456: 
 1457: set(N, #diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group)
 1458:   when N == {record, diameter_base_RAR};
 1459:        N == {record, nas_RAR};
 1460:        N == {map, 'RAR'};
 1461:        N == {list, 'RAR'} ->
 1462:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, DH},
 1463:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
 1464:         = Caps,
 1465:     set(Group, Req, [{'Session-Id', [diameter:session_id(OH)]},
 1466:                      {'Origin-Host',  [OH]},
 1467:                      {'Origin-Realm', [OR]},
 1468:                      {'Destination-Host',  [DH]},
 1469:                      {'Destination-Realm', [DR]},
 1470:                      {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID}]).
 1471: 
 1472: %% name/1
 1473: 
 1474: name([H|#{}]) ->
 1475:     {map, H};
 1476: 
 1477: name([H|_]) ->
 1478:     {list, H};
 1479: 
 1480: name(Rec) ->
 1481:     try
 1482:         {record, element(1, Rec)}
 1483:     catch
 1484:         error: badarg ->
 1485:             false
 1486:     end.
 1487: 
 1488: %% prepare_retransmit/6
 1489: 
 1490: prepare_retransmit(_Pkt, false, _Peer, _Group, _Name, _) ->
 1491:     discard.
 1492: 
 1493: %% handle_answer/7-8
 1494: 
 1495: handle_answer(Pkt, Req, [$C|_], Peer, Group, Name, _) ->
 1496:     answer(Pkt, Req, Peer, Name, Group).
 1497: 
 1498: handle_answer(Pkt, Req, [$C|_], Peer, Group, send_detach = Name, _, X) ->
 1499:     {Pid, Ref} = X,
 1500:     Pid ! {Ref, answer(Pkt, Req, Peer, Name, Group)}.
 1501: 
 1502: answer(Pkt, Req, _Peer, Name, #group{client_dict = Dict0}) ->
 1503:     #diameter_packet{header = H, msg = Ans, errors = Es} = Pkt,
 1504:     ApplId = app(Req, Name, Dict0),
 1505:     #diameter_header{application_id = ApplId} = H,  %% assert
 1506:     answer(Ans, Es, Name).
 1507: 
 1508: %% Missing Result-Code and inappropriate Experimental-Result-Code.
 1509: answer(Ans, Es, send_experimental_result) ->
 1510:     [{5004, #diameter_avp{name = 'Experimental-Result'}},
 1511:      {5005, #diameter_avp{name = 'Result-Code'}}]
 1512:         =  Es,
 1513:     Ans;
 1514: 
 1515: %% An inappropriate E-bit results in a decode error ...
 1516: answer(Ans, Es, send_bad_answer) ->
 1517:     [{5004, #diameter_avp{name = 'Result-Code'}} | _] = Es,
 1518:     Ans;
 1519: 
 1520: %% ... while other errors are reflected in Failed-AVP.
 1521: answer(Ans, [], _) ->
 1522:     Ans.
 1523: 
 1524: app(_, send_unsupported_app, _) ->
 1525:     ?BAD_APP;
 1526: app(Req, _, Dict0) ->
 1527:     Dict = dict(Req, Dict0),
 1528:     Dict:id().
 1529: 
 1530: %% handle_error/7
 1531: 
 1532: handle_error(timeout = Reason, _Req, [$C|_], _Peer, _, _, Time) ->
 1533:     Now = diameter_lib:now(),
 1534:     {Reason, {diameter_lib:timestamp(Time),
 1535:               diameter_lib:timestamp(Now),
 1536:               diameter_lib:micro_diff(Now, Time)}};
 1537: 
 1538: handle_error(Reason, _Req, [$C|_], _Peer, _, _, _Time) ->
 1539:     {error, Reason}.
 1540: 
 1541: %% handle_request/4
 1542: 
 1543: %% Note that diameter will set Result-Code and Failed-AVPs if
 1544: %% #diameter_packet.errors is non-null.
 1545: 
 1546: handle_request(#diameter_packet{header = H, avps = As}
 1547:                = Pkt,
 1548:                _,
 1549:                {_Ref, Caps},
 1550:                #group{encoding = E,
 1551:                       server_decoding = D}
 1552:                = Grp) ->
 1553:     #diameter_header{end_to_end_id = EI,
 1554:                      hop_by_hop_id = HI}
 1555:         = H,
 1556:     {V,B} = ?CLIENT_MASK,
 1557:     V = EI bsr B,  %% assert
 1558:     V = HI bsr B,  %%
 1559:     #diameter_caps{origin_state_id = {_,[Id]}} = Caps,
 1560:     {D,E} = T = origin(Id),  %% assert
 1561:     wrap(T, H, request(to_map(Pkt, Grp), [H|As], Caps)).
 1562: 
 1563: wrap(Id, H, {Tag, Action, Post}) ->
 1564:     {Tag, wrap(Id, H, Action), Post};
 1565: 
 1566: wrap(_, _, {reply, [#diameter_header{} | _]} = T) ->
 1567:     T;
 1568: 
 1569: wrap({_,E}, H, {reply, Ans}) ->
 1570:     Msg = base_to_nas(msg(Ans, E, diameter_gen_base_rfc3588), H),
 1571:     {reply, wrap(Msg)};
 1572: 
 1573: wrap(_, _, T) ->
 1574:     T.
 1575: 
 1576: %% Randomly wrap the answer in a diameter_packet.
 1577: 
 1578: wrap(#diameter_packet{} = Pkt) ->
 1579:     Pkt;
 1580: 
 1581: wrap(Msg) ->
 1582:     case rand:uniform(2) of
 1583:         1 -> #diameter_packet{msg = Msg};
 1584:         2 -> Msg
 1585:     end.
 1586: 
 1587: %% base_to_nas/2
 1588: 
 1589: base_to_nas(#diameter_packet{msg = Msg} = Pkt, H) ->
 1590:     Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = base_to_nas(Msg, H)};
 1591: 
 1592: base_to_nas(Rec, #diameter_header{application_id = 1})
 1593:   when is_tuple(Rec), not ?is_record(Rec, 'diameter_base_answer-message') ->
 1594:     D = case element(1, Rec) of
 1595:             diameter_base_accounting_ACA ->
 1596:                 diameter_gen_base_accounting;
 1597:             _ ->
 1598:                 diameter_gen_base_rfc3588
 1599:         end,
 1600:     [R | Values] = D:'#get-'(Rec),
 1601:     "diameter_base_" ++ N = ?L(R),
 1602:     Name = ?A("nas_" ++ if N == "accounting_ACA" ->
 1603:                                 "ACA";
 1604:                            true ->
 1605:                                 N
 1606:                         end),
 1607:     nas4005:'#new-'([Name | Values]);
 1608: 
 1609: base_to_nas(Msg, _) ->
 1610:     Msg.
 1611: 
 1612: %% request/3
 1613: 
 1614: %% send_experimental_result
 1615: request(['ACR' | #{'Accounting-Record-Number' := 5}],
 1616:         [Hdr | Avps],
 1617:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1618:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1619:     [H,R|T] = [A || N <- ['Origin-Host',
 1620:                           'Origin-Realm',
 1621:                           'Session-Id',
 1622:                           'Accounting-Record-Type',
 1623:                           'Accounting-Record-Number'],
 1624:                     #diameter_avp{} = A
 1625:                         <- [lists:keyfind(N, #diameter_avp.name, Avps)]],
 1626:     Ans = [Hdr#diameter_header{is_request = false},
 1627:            H#diameter_avp{data = OH},
 1628:            R#diameter_avp{data = OR},
 1629:            #diameter_avp{name = 'Experimental-Result',
 1630:                          code = 297,
 1631:                          need_encryption = false,
 1632:                          data = [#diameter_avp{data = {?DIAMETER_DICT_COMMON,
 1633:                                                        'Vendor-Id',
 1634:                                                        123}},
 1635:                                  #diameter_avp{data
 1636:                                                = {?DIAMETER_DICT_COMMON,
 1637:                                                   'Experimental-Result-Code',
 1638:                                                   3987}}]}
 1639:            | T],
 1640:     {reply, Ans};
 1641: 
 1642: request(Msg, _Avps, Caps) ->
 1643:     request(Msg, Caps).
 1644: 
 1645: %% request/2
 1646: 
 1647: %% send_nok
 1648: request(['ACR' | #{'Accounting-Record-Number' := 0}],
 1649:         _) ->
 1650:     {eval_packet, {protocol_error, ?INVALID_AVP_BITS}, [fun log/2, invalid]};
 1651: 
 1652: %% send_bad_answer
 1653: request(['ACR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId,
 1654:                    'Accounting-Record-Type' := RT,
 1655:                    'Accounting-Record-Number' := 2 = RN}],
 1656:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1657:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1658:     Ans = ['ACA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1659:                   {'Session-Id', SId},
 1660:                   {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1661:                   {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1662:                   {'Accounting-Record-Type', RT},
 1663:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', RN}],
 1664: 
 1665:     {reply, #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{is_error = true},%% NOT
 1666:                              msg = Ans}};
 1667: 
 1668: %% send_eval
 1669: request(['ACR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId,
 1670:                    'Accounting-Record-Type' := RT,
 1671:                    'Accounting-Record-Number' := 3 = RN}],
 1672:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1673:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1674:     Ans = ['ACA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1675:                   {'Session-Id', SId},
 1676:                   {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1677:                   {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1678:                   {'Accounting-Record-Type', RT},
 1679:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', RN}],
 1680:     {eval, {reply, Ans}, {erlang, now, []}};
 1681: 
 1682: %% send_ok
 1683: request(['ACR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId,
 1684:                    'Accounting-Record-Type' := RT,
 1685:                    'Accounting-Record-Number' := 1 = RN}],
 1686:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1687:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1688:     {reply, ['ACA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1689:                     {'Session-Id', SId},
 1690:                     {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1691:                     {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1692:                     {'Accounting-Record-Type', RT},
 1693:                     {'Accounting-Record-Number', RN}]};
 1694: 
 1695: %% send_protocol_error
 1696: request(['ACR' | #{'Accounting-Record-Number' := 4}],
 1697:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1698:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1699:     %% Include a DOIC AVP that will be encoded/decoded because of
 1700:     %% avp_dictionaries config.
 1701:     OLR = #{'OC-Sequence-Number' => 1,
 1702:             'OC-Report-Type' => 0,  %% HOST_REPORT
 1703:             'OC-Reduction-Percentage' => [25],
 1704:             'OC-Validity-Duration' => [60],
 1705:             'AVP' => [{'OC-Supported-Features', []}]},
 1706:     %% Include a NAS Failed-AVP AVP that will only be decoded under
 1707:     %% that application. Encode as 'AVP' since RFC 3588 doesn't list
 1708:     %% Failed-AVP in the answer-message grammar while RFC 6733 does.
 1709:     NP = #diameter_avp{data = {nas4005, 'NAS-Port', 44}},
 1710:     FR = #diameter_avp{name = 'Firmware-Revision', value = 12}, %% M=0
 1711:     AP = #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Grace-Period', value = 13}, %% M=1
 1712:     Failed = #diameter_avp{data = {diameter_gen_base_rfc3588,
 1713:                                    'Failed-AVP',
 1714:                                    [{'AVP', [NP,FR,AP]}]}},
 1715:     Ans = ['answer-message', {'Result-Code', ?TOO_BUSY},
 1716:                              {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1717:                              {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1718:                              {'AVP', [{'OC-OLR', OLR}, Failed]}],
 1719:     {reply, Ans};
 1720: 
 1721: %% send_proxy_info
 1722: request(['ASR' | #{'Proxy-Info' := _}],
 1723:         _) ->
 1724:     {protocol_error, 3999};
 1725: 
 1726: request(['ASR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId} = Avps],
 1727:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1728:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1729:     {reply, ['ASA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1730:                     {'Session-Id', SId},
 1731:                     {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1732:                     {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1733:                     {'AVP', maps:get('AVP', Avps, [])}]};
 1734: 
 1735: %% send_invalid_reject
 1736: request(['STR' | #{'Termination-Cause' := ?USER_MOVED}],
 1737:         _Caps) ->
 1738:     {protocol_error, ?TOO_BUSY};
 1739: 
 1740: %% send_noreply
 1741: request(['STR' | #{'Termination-Cause' := T}],
 1742:         _Caps)
 1743:   when T /= ?LOGOUT ->
 1744:     discard;
 1745: 
 1746: %% send_destination_5
 1747: request(['STR' | #{'Destination-Realm' := R}],
 1748:         #diameter_caps{origin_realm = {OR, _}})
 1749:   when R /= undefined, R /= OR ->
 1750:     {protocol_error, ?REALM_NOT_SERVED};
 1751: 
 1752: %% send_destination_6
 1753: request(['STR' | #{'Destination-Host' := [H]}],
 1754:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _}})
 1755:   when H /= OH ->
 1756:     {protocol_error, ?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER};
 1757: 
 1758: request(['STR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId}],
 1759:         #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
 1760:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1761:     {reply, ['STA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1762:                     {'Session-Id', SId},
 1763:                     {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1764:                     {'Origin-Realm', OR}]};
 1765: 
 1766: %% send_error/send_timeout
 1767: request(['RAR' | #{}], _Caps) ->
 1768:     receive after 2000 -> {protocol_error, ?TOO_BUSY} end.
 1769: 
 1770: %% message/3
 1771: %%
 1772: %% Limit the number of messages received. More can be received if read
 1773: %% in the same packet.
 1774: 
 1775: message(recv = D, {[_], Bin}, N) ->
 1776:     message(D, Bin, N);
 1777: message(Dir, #diameter_packet{bin = Bin}, N) ->
 1778:     message(Dir, Bin, N);
 1779: 
 1780: %% incoming request
 1781: message(recv, <<_:32, 1:1, _/bits>> = Bin, N) ->
 1782:     [Bin, N < 16, fun ?MODULE:message/3, N+1];
 1783: 
 1784: %% incoming answer
 1785: message(recv, Bin, _) ->
 1786:     [Bin];
 1787: 
 1788: %% outgoing
 1789: message(send, Bin, _) ->
 1790:     [Bin];
 1791: 
 1792: %% sent request
 1793: message(ack, <<_:32, 1:1, _/bits>>, _) ->
 1794:     [];
 1795: 
 1796: %% sent answer or discarded request
 1797: message(ack, _, N) ->
 1798:     [N =< 16, fun ?MODULE:message/3, N-1].
 1799: 
 1800: %% ------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1801: 
 1802: compile_and_load() ->
 1803:     Path = hd([P || H <- [[here(), ".."], [code:lib_dir(diameter)]],
 1804:                     P <- [filename:join(H ++ ["examples",
 1805:                                               "dict",
 1806:                                               "rfc4005_nas.dia"])],
 1807:                     {ok, _} <- [file:read_file_info(P)]]),
 1808:     Opts = [return,
 1809:             forms,
 1810:             {name, "nas4005"},
 1811:             {prefix, "nas"},
 1812:             {inherits, "common/diameter_gen_base_rfc3588"}],
 1813:     {ok, [Forms]} = diameter_make:codec(Path, Opts),
 1814:     {ok, nas4005, Bin, []} = compile:forms(Forms, [debug_info, return]),
 1815:     {module, nas4005} = code:load_binary(nas4005, "nas4005", Bin).
 1816: 
 1817: here() ->
 1818:     filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)).
